A complete plugin for moving and duplicating blocks and lines, with complete fold handling, reindenting, and undoing in one go.
Foldtext customization and folded region preview.
Explain the regular expression under the cursor.
Readline keyboard shortcuts for Neovim.

Formatting.desc: An EditorConfig plugin for Neovim written in Fennel.
A format runner for Neovim written in Lua.
A wrapper around Neovims native LSP formatting.
This plugin trims trailing whitespace and lines.
Clear trailing whitespace and empty lines at end of file on every save.

Web development.desc: A fast Neovim http client written in Lua.

Media.desc: Neovim Lua plugin to paste image from clipboard.
A picgo-core-based Neovim plugin, written in Lua, that allows you to upload images to the image bed, which means you can view your images from anywhere on the internet.
Remote control Reaper DAW from Neovim.

Discord Rich Presence.desc: Fast and lite Discord Rich Presence plugin for Neovim written in Lua.

Command Line.desc: A plugin for fuzzy command line autocompletion.

Session.desc: A small automated session manager for Neovim.
Module of `mini.nvim` for session management (read, write, delete).
Simple session management with git branching, autosave/autoload and Telescope support.
Flexible session management with arbitrary persistent data stored as JSON.

Test.desc: The ultimate testing plugin for Neovim.
A Neovim plugin to easily run and debug Jest tests.
A Neovim wrapper for running tests.
An extensible framework for interacting with tests within Neovim.

Competitive Programming.desc: Neovim helper for competitive programming written in Lua.
A plugin to automate testcases management and checking for Competitive Programming contests.

Preconfigured Configuration.desc: Abstract, The NeoVim configuration to achieve the power of Modern IDE.
A community-driven modular vim/neovim distribution, like spacemacs but for vim/neovim.
CosmicNvim is a lightweight and opinionated Neovim config for web development, specifically designed to provide a üí´ COSMIC programming experience!
A fast general-purpose IDE written entirely in Lua with an installer for Linux/Windows/macOS and built in `:CodeArtUpdate` command for updating it.

Port of the doom-emacs framework, its goal is to add useful functions to Neovim to start working in a stable and efficient development environment without spending a lot of time configuring everything.
Neovim custom configuration, oriented for full stack developers (rails, ruby, php, html, css, SCSS, JavaScript).
This project aims to help one transition away from VSCode, and into a superior text editing experience.
A NeoVim config for THE ULTIMATE vim IDE-like experience.
A full-featured NeoVim distribution, packaged with Nix Flake for easy installation and reproducibility.
An attempt to make Neovim cli as functional as an IDE while being very beautiful and less bloated.
Simple Neovim config written in Lua with all the modern features available in any **IDE**
A modular NeoVim configuration with beautiful UI and some useful features(Pomodoro Clock, Window Number).
Roshnivim, can be called neovim's distro, is a predefined configs so that you don't need 1000hr to setup neovim as an IDE.
AstroNvim is an aesthetic and feature-rich Neovim config that is extensible and easy to use with a great set of plugins.
Blazing fast, configurable, minimal and lispy neovim config written in Fennel. Base config for users to extend and add upon, leading to a more unique editing experience.
A lightweight Neovim config for web development.
An excellent Neovim configuration, which is as powerful as Vscode, is lightning fast ‚ö°Ô∏è.
Dusk is a lightweight, aesthetically minimal Neovim config, written in Lua, able to provide for web and Java development.

Keybinding.desc: Neovim plugin that shows a popup with possible keybindings of the command you started typing.
Define your keymaps, commands, and autocommands as simple Lua tables, and create a legend for them at the same time, integrates with `which-key.nvim`.
a more convenient `:map`ping syntax for Lua environments.
A simpler key mapping API that mimics Neovim's `:map`-family of commands. Integrates with which-key.nvim.
Lua utility to map keys concisely using cascading trees. Also allows binding Lua functions to keys.
Lua plugin to create key-bindings and watch them with telescope.
A ridiculously fun alternative keymap for the workman keyboard layout with nvim features like LSP support, built and configured with lua.
Create and manage keybindings and commands in a more organized manner and search them quickly through Telescope.
Key mapping hints in a floating window.
Create custom submodes and menus. Port of Emacs Hydra.

Tmux.desc: Tmux integration for Neovim features pane movement and resizing from within Neovim.
Smoothly navigate between Neovim splits and Tmux panes.
Collection of window functions which includes moving between, closing and maximizing Neovim splits and Tmux panes.

Remote Development.desc: Edit files, run programs, and work with LSP on a remote machine from the comfort of your local environment.
Develop inside docker containers, just like VSCode.
Neovim devcontainer.json and general development container support.

Split and Window.desc: A zen mode for improving code readability on Neovim.
Auto-Focusing and Auto-Resizing Splits/Windows for Neovim written in Lua! Vim splits on steroids.
Stabilized window content on window open/close events.

Version Manager.desc: A cross platform and easy to use Neovim version manager.
A lightweight and blazing fast Neovim version manager.
A Neovim version manager written in Lua.

Boilerplate.desc: Create boilerplate structure for Neovim plugins.
Showcases various plugins for vim and has a [neovim tag](https://vimawesome.com/?q=tag:neovim) for other plugins targeting Neovim.
Short list of vim plugins and helpful guides.
List of vim and Neovim plugins.
A site dedicated to searching for Neovim specific plugins and guides for building plugins in Lua.
